pli-tv-kd22:1.1.1: One hundred years after the Buddha had attained final extinguishment, the Vajjian monks of Vesālī proclaimed ten practices as allowable:

pli-tv-kd22:2.7.13: “Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.14: While we were discussing this legal issue, there was endless talk, but not a single statement that could be understood.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.15: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should appoint four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.17: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.18: While we were discussing this legal issue, there was endless talk, but not a single statement that could be understood.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.19: The Sangha appoints four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.20: Any monk who approves of appointing four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.21: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.22: The Sangha has appointed four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.23: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.24: At that time there was a monk called Ajita who had ten years of seniority and was the Sangha’s reciter of the Monastic Code.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.26: to assign seats to the senior monks.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.28: “Where should we resolve this legal issue?”
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.30: “There is the Vālika Monastery, which is delightful, quiet, and free from chatter.
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.31: Let’s resolve this legal issue there.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.7.32: And they went to the Vālika Monastery
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.2: “Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.5: “Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.11: and then eat it whenever the food is unsalted?”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.14: “At Sāvatthī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.16: “An offense entailing confession for eating what has been stored.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.17: “Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.20: I make a note of this first decision.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.23: “Is it allowable to eat at the wrong time, so long as the shadow of the sundial is within two fingerbreadths of midday?”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.26: “At Rājagaha, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.28: “An offense entailing confession for eating at the wrong time.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.29: “Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.32: I make a note of this second decision.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.35: “When you have finished your meal and refused an invitation to eat more, is it allowable to eat non-leftover food if you intend to go to the next village?”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.38: “At Sāvatthī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.40: “An offense entailing confession for eating what is not left over.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.44: I make a note of this third decision.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.47: “When there are a number of monasteries within the same monastery zone, is it allowable to do the observance-day ceremony separately?”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.50: “At Rājagaha, in what is connected to the observance-day ceremony.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.52: “An act of wrong conduct for going beyond the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.56: I make a note of this fourth decision.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.59: “Is it allowable to do a legal procedure with an incomplete Sangha,
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.60: with the intention of getting consent from the absent monks afterwards?”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.63: “In the section on Those from Campā, in the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-kd22:2.8.127: “The legal issue has been resolved and properly disposed of.
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.128: Nevertheless, for the purpose of convincing the other monks, you should ask me about these ten practices also in the midst of the Sangha.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.129: Revata then asked Sabbakāmī about these ten practices in the midst of the Sangha.
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.130: And Sabbakāmī was able to reply to every question.
pli-tv-kd22:2.9.1: At this communal recitation of the Monastic Law there were seven hundred monks, neither more nor less. This is why this communal recitation is called “The group of seven hundred”.
pli-tv-kd22:2.9.2: The twelfth chapter on the group of seven hundred is finished. In this chapter there are twenty-five topics.
pli-tv-kd22:2.9.16: The chapter on the group of seven hundred is finished.
pli-tv-kd22:2.9.18: The canonical text of the Short Division is finished.
